title: Artificial Intelligence

definitions.Input: The data fed into the networks
definitions.Target: The desired output of the target network
definitions.Prediction: The output of the prediction network
definitions.Parameter update: The process of adjusting the network parameters

formulas: Q(s', a'; θi^-1) = r + γ max Q(s', a'; θi^-1)
Q(s, a; θi) = Q(s, a; θi)
summary: The slide presents a diagram of a Deep Q-Network (DQN) algorithm, which is a reinforcement learning technique. It shows the flow of data from input to the prediction network, which predicts the Q-value for a given state and action. The target network's Q-value is calculated using the Bellman equation, and the difference between the target and prediction Q-values is used to update the parameters of the prediction network.
